page.title: 03MAENDY VILLAGE - ATTITUDES
page.content: There are about 30 houses. The B4270 virtually cuts the village in half. Many people would like a bypass built. It has a primary school & a chapel which holds services & Sunday School in Welsh. Only 9 people speak Welsh, 2 fluently. Most people come from England, though 1 family was from the USA & 1 from S.AFRICA. Only 2 families were native to the Vale. The chapel goers come from all over the area. There are no shops & the Post Office has closed from lack of trade. People use Cowbridge for their daily shopping & usually Cardiff for more important purchases. Most people liked the village, the adults complained about noise & litter from the school & some children found it boring because their friends didn't live close by.
